name: saint
text:
I believe that to be the opposite of my problem.

P.S. I do not think you are an asshole and I should not have said so.

name: rowboat
text: Oh, I was. It's OK to say so. Still am, too, if you'd like to continue saying so.

name: saint
text:
I have no interest in unwarranted douchebaggery this time around. Farqussus seems determined to declare his hatred of me from the assetbar rooftops, but I shall not stoop

Is It irony that, by complaining so irrationally about me that he's doing exactly what he said about me?

name: semiquaver
text:
Onstad.

Um, hi. For Christmas I would like a pony, an ice cream making machine, a doll with real light-up eyes that flash, a dirigible...

Oh, wait, I got you confused with Santa Claus because you just give us so damn much . I am gonna order the cookbook as soon as I get funds and then I am gonna learn to cook such as recipes, thus making myself more independent and a better romantic prospect and so on. You have probably just chosen my future soulmate and you do not even know it.

[/wig]

name: twohundredninety
text:
Oh dude. I meant to give you a chubby for this but accidentally clicked the lame button instead. Sorry about that, dude.

It would be great if there were a way to fix mistakes like that.

name: deusoma
text: Update: seven months later, we still can't fix shit like that.

name: daidai
text: Update: Eleven months after this, we still can't fix it. I make one of these mistakes daily.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Update: one hour after this, we still can't fix it.

name: theguitarhero
text: Update: 3 days after both instances we can't fix it.

name: rowboat
text:
One month after these and I have finally found a way to fix it! Try to stay with me. This is some advanced shit. First, you put your eyes on the "screen" and focus them (using both eyes) on the words "chubby" and "lame." They're close enough together that you can basically look at both at the same time. Then you put your hand on the "mouse" to make the little arrow move. If you liked the comment (if it made you happy or caused you to not be pissed off), make the little arrow point to the word "chubby." If you dis liked the comment (if it made you unhappy or angry), simply place the arrow on the word "lame." When you have decided how you feel and have placed the arrow accordingly, click the left button on your "mouse."

Let's see assetbarista do that shit. Nope. It's all you, buddy.

name: rowboat
text: That was way too much effort to put into an unfunny and bitchy joke. I realized this a few sentences in, but by then it was too late. I am sorry.

text: Chubby for "follow-tought"

name: rowboat

name: molesticide
text:
my input seems excessively unneccessary.

but, damn. i think someone else even already mentioned it, this strip is the best representation of that moment, ten minutes after lightin' up a BIG one, that i have ever seen. i have had thoughts exactly paralleling ray's, albeit suited to my own hallucinatory context.

proprs, onstad- you have demonstrated your familiarity with the subject at hand. i hope that your own mom knows what kind of 'research' you do for your art.

(yeah, that's supposed to be spelled 'props.' but i kind of like the typo- say it out loud.)

name: darthemed
text: Far and away my favorite Achewood. It makes me wonder if Onstad gets irritated at all by so many people thinking that a comic he did using 'stoner humor' (although these is so far past the likes of Cheech and That 70s Show segments it is awesome in the classic sense). Sort of like Dax Riggs wanting to be recognized for more than Acid Bath.

name: fosters
text: I wouldn't be shocked if he looked at this kind of like Dave Chappelle looked at the Rick James skit. Hamstrung by their own hilarity.

name: darthemed
text: Also, strips like these are the reason there are voting options below 3, despite what deancain29 might say. We need to be able to highlight the greatest.

name: steerpike66
text:
Ray%u2019s observation in the central frame is a profoundly important thought and one which we should all remember and take to heart. Being in trouble is a fake idea. So is getting laughed at. There%u2019s nothing to be afraid of. Because you are from%u2026


%u2026History!

name: paco
text:
One of my favorite strips of all time. The line about being in trouble is a fake idea has become my motto-thingy.

Also, could someone with a large amount of experience give some advice on the best way with which to taketh one's pleasure from the herb? IE, bong, vaporizer, blunt, ect. Rating on concealability, ease on the lungs, pleasure, ect.

name: rowboat
text: Anal suppositories. They rate 10 out of 10 on concealability [ sic ], ease on the lungs, pleasure, ect. [ sic ]

name: aki
text: Despite the lovely tangency, Trainspotting references, and concealability that suppositories might offer, one word: bubblers.

name: clever-nickname
text: like many others, I will now exclaim "wait! i am from... history!" during my daily life.

name: slog
text: A comment left by slog was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by clocked, jargonmaster, nutmeg)

name: toasterhead
text: I Know Todd

name: plummet
text: i am from...HISTORY

name: misterwolf
text: Ray is awesome.

name: johnmatrix
text: I think it'd be funny if Ray had a different "history" outfit on each time you refreshed the strip. But maybe that's just because I can never remember what it looks like.

name: dasilodavi
text: This looks like more fun than I have being stoned.  All I can do is think about thinking, and wonder if my brain is broken because I can't get off that one ridiculous stream of thought.

name: avedestron
text: It's really terrifying how dead on this is.

name: bachamp
text: What, my friends wants to borrow my cap, maybe he's gonna steal it and sell it to some gypsie, he aint gonna get my cap, my cap.... i wish i could get out of here, no im to high, the people, the cops, my family will know, oh yeez. Golden american..... God, i want a smoke, *fumbles and looks around* And so on.

name: rexsjain
text:
masterpiece. smoking up on an ocean blue toilet seat. 'foot balle'.

God is that obvious.

A fucking masterpiece.

name: buttermoths
text:
Huh, it's "No one should be a COCK to a stranger, ever"! This is one of Achewood's most quoted lines, yet almost everyone seems to think it's "dick". Probably because of Pat (not for the craving, but for him being one). Cock is so much better.
Ahem.
Also, when I get stoned nowadays I react like Roast Beef...hella angsty, yo. I envy Ray here. Not in the last two panels and the next strip, though. That's me, all the way.

name: wittyname
text: Little does Ray know that his mom does know.

name: tbtabby
text: This is fifteen rounds of rapid-fire awesome spewing forth from an awesomeness gatling gun! Every single panel, individually, is awesome! Put together, they become a mighty awesomeness gestalt!

name: foxtrotamend
text: My favorite part of this strip is the fact that Ray gets the same mustache for his history costume and his football costume.

name: mirablu
text:
I hit "random comic" for the first or second time, and it came up with this.

I guess either the random comic button likes me, or it is very intelligent in its comic choices.

name: jay-smuckles
text:
45 degrees.


that is actually the answer to all existence.
its the meaning of life.
so much more than the rule of up-right objects...


Ray for President !!

name: c_dizzle
text: [a href="http://achewood.com/dat/comic/06132002_orig.gif"/]I thought panels 12 refers to this[/a]

name: c_dizzle
text: assetbar, you tricked me.

name: donward2
text: This, my friends, is the strip that started it all for me. This is perfection in every way. Bless you Onstad!

name: rowboat
text: Hey, I was kind of zoning out up there. Has anyone mentioned that this strip is good?

name: tenthman
text: Andy no longer has the three brews, I like to imagine that he pounded them in succession.

name: underpantstime
text: man if you were a cop you could like obtain a warrant to arrest chris onstad on charges of drug abuse, and you wouldn't need any other evidence. no drugs, no medical testing, just this strip. onstad's lawyer would just have to give up any hope.

name: heccibiggs
text: Very good point, but of course the judge and jury would all go down as well for going "Man, that is so spot on! " the second they were shown this strip.

name: comrade_tom
text: Shakespeare, Geometry, profound statements, achewood at its highest echelon

name: cherubrocker22
text: best strip ever

name: hootplate
text: Acheworld seems to love any strip with many many frames

name: bertson
text: "I know Todd" is obviously great, but "Those are some pans that I have" is a really under-rated panel.

name: clocked
text: History Ray looks like he's about to teleport, or get down

name: lexsenthur
text: I have to say: this comic destroyed decades of anti-drug messages the public school instilled.

name: ghede
text: That forty-five degrees thing looks like something I would do, but without the pot.

name: fosters
text: Ray is a much more positive stoner than I am. I'm kind of jealous, actually.

name: ihatemyself
text:
this strip really reminds me of this song

http://www.soundclick.com/util/getplayer.m3u?id=6083340&q=hi

name: starrtennis
text: Forty-five degrees.

name: sheriff_mittens
text: This strip is heartbreaking.

name: leia
text: why?

name: rainbowbrite
text: After being stoned I much prefer it when the awesome thoughts are lost in the haze... so I can maintain the illusion that something really meaningful happened in my brain, and I smile a lot.

name: grunchorelaxo
text: Ray passes left. Ray has etiquette .

name: mt85
text: Is there any reason why Teodor is Ray in the first panel? The two Rays was messing with me until I read on to the next one.

name: deusoma
text: This one more than makes up for the webcomic one. Perfect 5 in every conceivable way.

name: scootypuff
text: A comment left by scootypuff was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Deusoma, Fixipoo, Tagrineth, atticusonline, vexingrupert, theplaidknight, littlefatdog, The_Clarkness, Tipist, pogo)

name: tagrineth
text:
This comment is full of fail.

...well, someone had to say it

name: sp1derbaby
text: Scootypuff's comment is full of opinion. Nothing wrong with that.

name: chachibenji
text: People from history have INTENSE facial hair going on.

name: justa
text: Of course his mom knows.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Irrelevant, but, I just refreshed my inbox and it turns out I have another comment, but I went through the entire thing and can't find it. What the HELL Assetbar.

Phantom comment floating somewhere around my inbox...

(P.S. This strip is great.)

name: pogo
text: Reading this made me stoned.  Thanks Onstead.

name: pogo
text: I mean, thanks OnStar.

name: red-barchetta
text: I have been in this state before.....in History!

name: josearcadio
text: lol i think thats 90 degrees XD

name: dallovich
text:
Nono, his hand divides the 90 degree angle into a 45 degree angle.

Anyways that's how I have always read this strip.

name: theoddwaffle
text: I'm fairly sure I've delivered a few of these lines while under some sort of influence.

name: wonelove
text: classic Achewood, methinks

name: kovatch
text:
I bumped this to a 4.9

Fucking awesome strip.

name: conn
text: We are in a mathematical situation where I can switch the vote between 1 and 5 and watch the average jump between 4.8 and 4.9.  It's actually pretty funny.

name: singtralala
text: it's not that comfortable under my table, still, i'll give it a try, maybe i'll be all pensive

name: mrectomy
text: I actually ache from the laughter. Funniest strip I have ever seen by anyone ever.

name: mrectomy
text: as it turns out am I stoned too, which is why I think it's so funny, and why I misused the BBCODE.

name: killerstaplegun
text: i need a mustache....

name: inthetunk
text: This is top ten.  Exactly what it's like.

name: goatmasterflash
text: This was strip number 421 for me. Oh well. There is no planetary alignment. There is no conspiracy. There is just the regular amount of fear of the cops.

name: mustakrakesh
text: FORTY-FIVE DEGREES!

name: keir
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: tripleoptics
text: these situations seem familiar....

name: leeeee
text: That is definitely the hat i would choose if i were to discover that i'm from history.

name: tragicone
text: Having smoked weed, I can concur that this is the way you think.

name: deus
text: Should someone mention to him that Lord of the rings wasnt a historical pieace.

name: helixnebula
text: My favorite thing to do when I'm high is read the Wikipedia article on Consensus Reality.

name: terrynation
text: This really takes me back...

name: milo
text: ah, good times...

name: wallabeechamp
text: Being in trouble is a very real idea where stuff you care about is taken away from you and you never see them again.

name: aperson
text: 'Stuff' as in kidnapped children?

name: aperson
text: That you kidnapped?

name: aargh
text: Panels 5-7 are the funniest thing I have ever seen. Ever. Best stand alone strip.

name: sniffy
text: yes it is

name: srikamaraja
text:
Being a high-functioning stoner also from the land of History, I must go and find my anachronistic hat.

It is a stove-pipe hat. I cannot tell if I am Lincoln, or the Hitcher.

name: miku224
text: Honestly, guys, this strip is funny, but holy fuck can you quit it with the "dude this is JUST what being high is like."  Please stop it.

name: rowboat
text: dude this is JUST what being on PCP is like.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
pleaded the psychedelic neon dancing dinosaur to the tiny solipsists who all think they invented being stoned...

it is so tragically not hip

name: macfall
text: This is the strip that made me fall in love with Achewood.

name: calgit
text:
I really want to see what happens between panels 7-8...

I mean, does Ray just decide that he needs several more of those pans? And that he needs them RIGHT NOW?

name: duperando
text: "That's Todd. I know him"

name: hbananaplus
text: I know Todd.
